intro: Ionoxalis decaphylla, commonly known as the purple buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces yellowish-orange seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ionoxalis decaphylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
